creator: mdz@digital-mission.com
text:
When using mod_webapp as the connector between Apache and Tomcat 4.0b6,
example Tomcat JSP's behave incorrectly, apparently due to corrupted
information exchanged through the Warp protocol between mod_webapp and
Tomcat.  JSP problems occur only when accessed through port 80 and Apache;
JSP's behave correctly when accessed through port 8080 (built-in HTTP server).

Specific Example #1: snoop.jsp

When requested through port 80, the following Request data shown by
snoop are incorrect:

	Server Port: -1
	Remote Address: null
	Remote Host: null

Specific Example #2: Sessions Don't Work in numguess.jsp

Cookies appear to be corrupted in transfer because any session-scope
JSP creates a new session with every request - the servlet
engine does not realize that the request is coming from a browser with
an existing session.  Hence numguess always thinks your guess is
the first guess; the log shows the assignment of a new session ID
with each request.

--------------------
System Configuration

- Redhat Linux 7.1 (stock)
- Apache 1.3.19 DSO (stock w/ RH7.1)
- Tomcat 4.0b6 binary distribution
- apr snapshot - CHANGES shows b1
- jakarta-tomcat-connectors snapshot - date is morning after 4.0b6 release
- Warp connector code: Erroneous behavior persists whether warp.jar in
  Tomcat distro, or warp.jar built with "--with-java" in
  jakarta-tomcat-connectors are used.

Example 1 has been fixed as of now in CVS. Please test it.

Regarding Example 2, I'll have to copy some of the HTTP connector code 
to WARP.
